Brisbon

Brisbon is a Dea of the Charis who is frequently aligned with holy warriors and good-aligned adventurers. Though he is repeatedly chastised by Hera and punished by the withholding of his borrowed power, he remains ever direct in his interactions with mortals, prone to assigning them great quests, along with a gift of tangible power.

Brisbon's form is that of a muscular though aged humanoid who is rarely clad in the chitinous armour of his kin, preferring as little clothing as required to maintain the level of modesty appropriate for present company. His skin dark with complex tattoos, head to toe, which occasionally bear a blue sheen. From his face project two large tusks flanking a braided beard, and a mane of long hair flows from his head and back like a cape. The hair is consciously controlled and often shaped into a pair of majestic wings. From his tattoos he draws all manner of weapons, which he sometimes hands to mortals as a symbolic or literal gift of power, but he himself favours a great-hammer or blunt pole-arm.
